Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Although both dl - sotalol and azimilide rarely induced EADs in canine left ventricles , they produced frequent EADs in rabbits , in which more pronounced QT prolongation was seen .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease | 
| --- |
| EADs |
| QT prolongation |

EADs and QT prolongation are both considered diseases in the context of the paragraph. EADs stands for early afterdepolarizations, which are abnormal electrical activity in the heart that can lead to cardiac arrhythmias. QT prolongation refers to an abnormal lengthening of the QT interval on an electrocardiogram, which can also lead to cardiac arrhythmias.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to "Disease":

| --- |
| EADs |
| QT prolongation |

I removed "dl - sotalol" and "azimilide" since they are not diseases, but rather drugs that were mentioned in the context of the paragraph.
